title: PHPnext()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPnext()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Function

Example
Rewind to the first element, move to the 
the current() function:
<?php
$note=<<<XML
<note>
<to>Tove</to>
<from>Jani</from>
<heading>Reminder</heading>
<body>Do not forget me this weekend!</body>
</note>
XML;
$xml = new SimpleXMLIterator($note);
// rewind to the first element
$xml->rewind();
// move to the 
$xml->
// 
  return current element
var_dump($xml->current());
?>
Run Example »

SimpleXMLIterator::

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
$note=<<<XML
<note>
<to>Tove</to>
<from>Jani</from>
<heading>Reminder</heading>
<body>Do not forget me this weekend!</body>
</note>
XML;
$xml = new SimpleXMLIterator($note);
// rewind to the first element
$xml->rewind();
// move to the next element
$xml->next();
// 
  return current element
var_dump($xml->current());
?>

practice_exercises.solution:
<?php
$note=<<<XML
<note>
<to>Tove</to>
<from>Jani</from>
<heading>Reminder</heading>
<body>Do not forget me this weekend!</body>
</note>
XML;
$xml = new SimpleXMLIterator($note);
// rewind to the first element
$xml->rewind();
// move to the next element
$xml->next();
// 
  return current element
var_dump($xml->current());
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPnext()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPnext()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPnext()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
